at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf

Class BufferManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.intf.BufferManager

  • public class BufferManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The BufferManager is used to create, configure and delete buffers.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferManager()
      Initialization of the buffer manager.

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Called by the garbage collector on this object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. All used system resources are released.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - the Exception raised by this method

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases all system resources. This method may be called more than once. If the buffer manager is already released, the method call will have no effect.

      • queryBuffersByName

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByName(java.lang.String bufferName)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        bufferName - a regular expression specifying the buffer name. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole buffer name.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByMetainfo(java.lang.String topic,
                                                               java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        topic - a regular expression specifying the buffer topics, which should be scanned for the wanted features. These are keys of the buffer meta information. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole topic name.
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        public java.util.Set<BufferDescription> queryBuffersByMetainfo(java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers. This query scans all topics of the buffer for the requested feature.
        Parameters:
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • get

        public BufferConfiguration get(java.lang.String name)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns the configuration of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the configuration of this buffer. The result may be null, if no communication with the buffer daemon is possible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is unknown

      • create

        public boolean create(java.lang.String name,
                      BufferConfiguration configuration)
        This method creates a new buffer with a given buffer configuration. If the buffer already exists, the buffer configuration is updated.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        configuration - the buffer configuration
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon

      • update

        public boolean update(java.lang.String name,
                      BufferConfiguration configuration)
        This method makes an update of the buffer configuration.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        configuration - the buffer configuration
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon

      • release

        public boolean release(java.lang.String name)
        This method releases the buffer with the given name and removes it from the set of known buffers.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        true, if the configuration was successfully changed in the daemon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is unknown
